result.execSummary:
The defendant John Allen Cox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
9 months in the House of Correction/Day Reporting Center. Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and treatment.
Consecutive to: any other sentence with credit for 4 days time served.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Maintain full time/part time employment and or schooling.
As a convicted felon defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.

Electronic monitoring ONLY as to the 9 months sentence NOT the condition time.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Random urine screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing.
MUST provide a DNA sample.
Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programs deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.
Court will consider expungement if defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding at the conclusion of the terms of probation.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and treatment. Court STAYED the condition time to be used at the discretion of the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Allen Cox

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Allen Cox in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements made as to sentencing by both counsel.
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction / Day Reporting Center, to run consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and treatment.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS with the following conditions as to probation:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Electronic monitoring ONLY as to the 9 MONTHS sentence NOT the Condition Time.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing.
*  MUST provide a DNA sample.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.
*  Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programs deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 30 DAYS condition time at the House of Correction with Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and treatment. 
Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the condition time to be used at the discretion of the agent.

Court will consider expungement if Defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding at the conclusion of the terms of probation.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant John Allen Cox in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John Allen Cox in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for Danielle Chojnacki for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requesting an adjournment. No objection from State. Court adjourned case for a Projected Guilty Plea in Branch 26.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant John Allen Cox in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-08-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John Allen Cox in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  William Levins for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/25/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant John Allen Cox in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Defendant John Allen Cox in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
